item.title: 长债收益率上升，黄金因财政问题创纪录
item.description: 由于对政府债务和经济增长的担忧加剧，周三全球长期债券的跌势延续至亚洲，而黄金则攀升至新高。【原文：A global slide in long-dated bonds extended into Asia on Wednesday, while gold climbed to a new peak as concerns mounted over government debt and economic growth.】

item.title: 消费者打开钱包，澳大利亚第二季度国内生产总值增速升至两年来新高
item.description: 周三的数据显示，由于消费者在经历了长期的消费低迷之后终于开始消费，澳大利亚经济在第二季度以近两年来最快的年增长率增长，取代政府成为经济增长的主要推动力。【原文：Australia's economy grew at the fastest annual pace in almost two years in the second quarter as consumers finally started spending after a long fallow stretch, data showed on Wednesday, taking over from the government as the main driver of growth.】

item.title: 巴西利用全球市场出售 2025 年第三笔债务，创十年之最
item.description: 巴西财政部周二进行了今年的第三次外债销售，这是拉丁美洲最大经济体自2014年以来首次在一年内进行两次以上的外债销售。【原文：Brazil's Treasury on Tuesday made its third foreign debt sale of the year, marking the first time since 2014 that Latin America's largest economy has conducted more than two external bond sales in a single year.】

item.title: 英镑、日元受财政和政治忧虑拖累
item.description: 投资者对全球政府财政健康状况的担忧和日本政局的不确定性再次引发了大量抛售，英镑和日元在周三承压。【原文：The British pound and the yen came under pressure on Wednesday, following heavy selling stoked by renewed investor worries about the health of government finances globally and political uncertainty in Japan.】

item.title: 油价守住美国制裁带来的涨幅
item.description: 周三亚市盘中，油价持稳，守住了上一交易日受制裁推动的涨幅，市场期待周末举行的欧佩克+会议。【原文：Oil prices were steady in Asian trading on Wednesday, holding on to sanctions-driven gains from the previous session as the market looked ahead to an OPEC+ meeting over the weekend.】

item.title: 美联储理事库克称抵押贷款 "矛盾 "不能成为特朗普撤职的理由
item.description: 美联储理事丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook）周二更详细地阐述了她反对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统解除她职务的立场，称现在才因她在确认过程中披露的抵押贷款信息而解雇她为时已晚。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook on Tuesday laid out in greater detail her opposition to President Donald Trump's bid to remove her from office, saying it was too late to fire her for mortgage information she disclosed during her confirmation process.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：美国财政部长将于周五开始美联储主席面试
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周二援引知情人士的话报道，美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）将于周五启动一系列面试，以遴选下一任美联储主席，面试过程将持续到下周。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent will launch a series of interviews on Friday to select the next Federal Reserve chair, with the process extending into next week, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 九月重启暴露美国市场潜在风险，投资者人心惶惶
item.description: 本周二，劳动节非官方夏末假期结束，市场重新开市，华尔街的夏日平静被打破，投资者正准备迎接更多的波动。【原文：Investors are bracing for more volatility after Wall Street’s summer lull gave way when markets reopened from the Labor Day unofficial end-of-summer holiday on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国证券和大宗商品监管机构宣布联合开展加密货币行动
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）和美国商品期货交易委员会（U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission）周二宣布了一项联合倡议，以协调数字资产方面的工作。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission and the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission on Tuesday announced a joint initiative to coordinate efforts on digital assets.】

item.title: 苹果和三星希望从谷歌搜索案中得到什么
item.description: 本周二，美国针对 Alphabet 旗下谷歌公司的搜索反垄断案作出裁决，对包括苹果和三星在内的手机制造商来说是一场胜利，法官称谷歌可以继续付费成为新设备的默认搜索引擎。【原文：A ruling in the U.S. search antitrust case against Alphabet's Google on Tuesday is a win for mobile phone manufacturers including Apple and Samsung , who a judge said Google can keep paying to be the default search engine on new devices.】

item.title: 交易日 "九月效应 "提前显现
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 大型科技公司如何应对美国反垄断诉讼
item.description: 本周二，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司在美国的一项诉讼中被勒令与竞争对手共享搜索数据，这只是美国反垄断执法机构挑战大型科技公司主导地位的主要行动之一。【原文：A U.S. lawsuit where Alphabet's Google was ordered on Tuesday to share search data with competitors is just one of the major efforts by U.S. antitrust enforcers to challenge Big Tech companies over their dominance.】

item.title: 美国法官命令谷歌与竞争对手共享搜索数据
item.description: 华盛顿的一名法官周二裁定，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌必须与竞争对手共享数据，以开放在线搜索领域的竞争，同时驳回了检察官要求这家互联网巨头出售其广受欢迎的 Chrome 浏览器的请求。【原文：Alphabet's Google must share data with competitors to open up competition in online search, a judge in Washington ruled on Tuesday, while rejecting prosecutors' bid to make the internet giant sell off its popular Chrome browser.】

item.title: 网络安全需求强劲，Zscaler 年收入高于预期
item.description: 周二，Zscaler 预测全年营收将超过华尔街预期，并押注随着企业升级基础设施以适应人工智能，其网络安全服务将迎来强劲需求，这使其股价在延时交易中上涨了 3%。【原文：Zscaler forecast annual revenue above Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, betting on robust demand for its cybersecurity services as businesses upscale infrastructure to accommodate AI, sending its shares up 3% in extended trading.】

item.title: 独家报道阿提哈德航空首席执行官认为自筹资金充足，不急于上市
item.description: 阿布扎比阿提哈德航空公司（Etihad Airways）首席执行官安东纳尔多-内维斯（Antonoaldo Neves）周二表示，该海湾航空公司没有上市的时间表，因为它有足够的资源 "自筹资金 "实施未来十年的 200 亿美元发展计划。【原文：Abu Dhabi's Etihad Airways CEO Antonoaldo Neves said on Tuesday the Gulf airline has no timeline for going public as it enjoys enough resources to "self-fund" its $20 billion growth plans for the next decade.】

item.title: 解说员：黄金破纪录的涨势：谁在支撑？
item.description: 周二，金价创下每金衡盎司 3,532 美元的纪录，延续了自 2022 年底以来已累计上涨 90% 以上的涨势。受多种因素影响，黄金需求预计将在一段时间内保持强劲。【原文：Gold prices hit a record $3,532 per troy ounce on Tuesday, extending a rally that has boosted them more than 90% since late 2022. Demand is expected to remain robust for some time due to a mix of factors.】

item.title: OpenAI 将收购产品测试初创公司 Statsig，并任命应用首席技术官
item.description: OpenAI 周二表示，它将以全股票交易的方式收购 Statsig，按照 OpenAI 目前 3000 亿美元的估值计算，这家产品测试初创公司的估值约为 11 亿美元。【原文：OpenAI said on Tuesday it will acquire Statsig in an all-stock deal valuing the product testing startup at about $1.1 billion based on OpenAI's current valuation of $300 billion.】

item.title: 巴西咖啡烘焙商因咖啡豆原料成本飙升而提价
item.description: 路透社在发给客户的文件中看到，3 Coracoes 和 Melitta 咖啡烘焙商正在提高其产品在巴西的价格，巴西是仅次于美国的世界第二大咖啡消费国。【原文：Coffee roasters 3 Coracoes and Melitta are raising prices for their products in Brazil, the world's second-largest coffee consumer behind the U.S., according to documents sent to clients and seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 迪斯尼将支付 1,000 万美元，以了结美国关于允许非法收集儿童数据的指控
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会（FTC）周二表示，迪斯尼公司将支付 1000 万美元，以了结该委员会对该公司的指控，即在未通知家长或未征得家长同意的情况下，非法允许收集在 YouTube 上观看儿童自导自演视频的儿童的个人数据。【原文：Walt Disney will pay $10 million to settle U.S. Federal Trade Commission allegations that the company unlawfully allowed personal data to be collected from children who viewed kid-directed videos on YouTube without notifying parents or obtaining their consent, the FTC said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 十大银行在美国债券交易反垄断诉讼中败诉
item.description: 本周二，一名美国法官驳回了一起指控 10 家大银行合谋操纵公司债券价格、损害普通投资者利益的反垄断诉讼，原法官因其妻子持有其中一家银行的股票而回避。【原文：A U.S. judge on Tuesday dismissed an antitrust lawsuit accusing 10 large banks of conspiring to rig corporate bond prices at the expense of ordinary investors, after the original judge recused himself because his wife owned stock in one of the banks.】

item.title: 美国八月份液化天然气出口量创历史新高
item.description: 金融公司 LSEG 的初步数据显示，8 月份美国液化天然气（LNG）出口量创下历史新高，原因是工厂退出了计划中的维护项目，Venture Global 的 Plaquemines 设施也继续提高产量。【原文：U.S. exports of liquefied natural gas (LNG) reached an all-time high in August as plants exited planned maintenance programs and Venture Global's Plaquemines facility continued to increase output, preliminary data from financial firm LSEG show.】

item.title: 竞争对手 Spirit 的第二次破产燃起了市场份额的希望，Frontier 大幅上涨
item.description: 边疆集团（Frontier Group）股价周二大涨 15%，投资者押注这家超低成本航空公司将在主要竞争对手精神航空（Spirit Airlines）数月内第二次破产并计划削减航线后抢占更多市场份额。【原文：Frontier Group shares jumped 15% on Tuesday, as investors bet that the ultra-low-cost carrier would scoop up more market share following main rival Spirit Airlines' second bankruptcy in months and plans to trim routes.】

item.title: 马斯克的 X 公司赢得了与前员工关于仲裁费的争执
item.description: 美国一家上诉法院周二裁定，不能强迫 X 公司支付因伊隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）收购这家社交媒体公司而失去工作的前员工所引起的一系列法律纠纷的仲裁预付费用。【原文：X Corp cannot be forced to cover the upfront fees of arbitrating a series of legal disputes by former employees who lost their jobs after Elon Musk acquired the social media company, a U.S. appeals court ruled on Tuesday.】

item.title: 与 Crypto.com 合作，在体育赛事合同上下注
item.description: 体育博彩公司 Underdog 已与 Crypto.com 的美国衍生品部门合作，允许客户通过赛事合同为体育联赛下注。【原文：Sports gaming company Underdog has partnered with Crypto.com's U.S. derivatives arm to allow customers to wager on sporting leagues through event contracts, the companies said on Tuesday.】

item.title: QUOTE BOX 卡夫亨氏押注分拆，但增长前景暗淡
item.description: 卡夫亨氏将分拆为两家上市公司，一家专注于食品杂货，另一家专注于调味酱和涂抹酱，从而取消长达十年之久的合并，因为这家包装食品生产商在多年销售低迷之后希望重振增长。【原文：Kraft Heinz will split into two listed companies, one focused on groceries and the other on sauces and spreads, undoing a decade-old merger as the packaged foods maker aims to revive growth after years of sluggish sales.】

item.title: 美联储降息迫在眉睫 助推金价再创新高
item.description: 对美国降息的预期、对美联储独立性的担忧以及投资者和央行的健康需求引发了黄金的最新涨势，很可能在未来几周内推动金价再创新高。【原文：Gold's latest rally triggered by expectations of U.S. rate cuts, concerns about Federal Reserve independence and healthy investor and central bank demand is likely to propel prices to new records over coming weeks.】

item.title: Anthropic 募集 130 亿美元资金后估值达 1 830 亿美元
item.description: 人工智能公司 Anthropic 周二表示，该公司已融资 130 亿美元，融资后估值为 1 830 亿美元，由投资公司 ICONIQ 主导。【原文：Artificial-intelligence company Anthropic said on Tuesday it had raised $13 billion at a $183 billion post-money valuation led by investment firm ICONIQ.】

item.title: 新墨西哥州将投资 3.15 亿美元推动量子计算发展
item.description: 新墨西哥州是世界上第一颗原子弹的试验地，本周二，该州计划投资 3.15 亿美元，力争成为另一项可能决定时代的技术--量子计算--的领导者。【原文：New Mexico, site of the world's first atomic bomb tests, on Tuesday plans to invest $315 million in a bid to become a leader in another potentially era-defining technology: quantum computing.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，派拉蒙与动视合作拍摄《使命召唤》真人电影
item.description: 据 CNBC 周二报道，派拉蒙 Skydance 公司已与微软旗下的动视暴雪公司达成协议，将视频游戏系列《使命召唤》改编成真人电影。【原文：Paramount Skydance has inked a deal with Microsoft-owned Activision Blizzard to adapt video game franchise 'Call of Duty' into a live-action feature film, CNBC reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 养老金谈判失败后汉莎航空可能面临飞行员罢工
item.description: 路透社周二看到的一封德国 VC 飞行员工会的信函显示，在与汉莎航空公司就其养老金计划的谈判破裂后，该工会呼吁其成员就罢工行动进行投票。【原文：Germany's VC pilots' union called for a ballot of its members on strike action after talks with airline Lufthansa on its pension scheme collapsed, a letter from the union seen by Reuters on Tuesday showed.】
